_description: The evil state of morality among clergy and laity — twelve short cross-rhymed quatrains

PierpontAcc35083.First Lines:
O pereles prynce of peaceand lorde of Lordes
                    all…
PierpontAcc35083.Last Lines:
…and pouertie may goo playe& all for lake of
                    grace
PierpontAcc35083.Note:
Last flyleaf before text, verso in the Morgan copy of 
            Robert of Shrewsbury, Here begynneth the lyf of the holy [and] blessid vyrgyn saynt
                Wenefryde, [Westminster: W. Caxton, 1485] ; added by a sixteenth-century hand; written as
                    prose.
PierpontAcc35083.Editions:
Bühler,  Kurt. 
             “A Satirical Poem of the Tudor Period.” 
             Anglia
         72 (1954): 419-22: 420-1.
